questions.question_text: A network technician is installing a new SOHO wireless router for a client. After configuring and securing the wireless network, the technician begins hardening the wireless router. Which of the following should the network technician do FIRST?

choices.B: Back up the configuration of the device.
choices.C: Configure an ACL for managing the device.

discussion.content: First, you finish setting ACL, mac filtering... etc then you back up your config.

comments.content: Please provide a source when giving a correction. I thought backup configuration would be the first step then your comment threw me off

discussion.content: service performance means baseline that it.

questions.question_text: A technician is investigating a server performance issue. The technician has gathered the server utilization statistics. Which of the following should the technician use to determine which statistics are not in the normal range?

discussion.content: I feel like every question so far that has isolation and one of the choices is DMZ as an answer ends up being DMZ as the answer.

questions.question_text: A network technician is configuring a new web server at the company office. The network manager has instructed the technician to implement it in such a way so it is isolated from the local network and still able to be reached from an external network. Which of the following BEST describes where the technician should set up the new server?

choices.D: Get an additional Internet connection from the current ISP.
choices.A: Adopt a multicloud strategy to ensure access in case of an outage.
choices.C: Lease additional office space for use in the event of a disaster.
choices.B: Contract a secondary ISP to provide another connection.

questions.question_text:
A company has decided to move its datacenter to an IaaS provider. The company stakeholders are concerned about their ISP being a single point of failure.
Which of the following will the network administrator MOST likely recommend to mitigate this risk?

discussion.content: i think A will be a better answer

Stakeholders are concerned about the cloud provider’s ISP so they are going to contract another ISP for the cloud provider? That doesn’t sound right

I think A is a better answer for this question

comments.content: They never said it was the IAAS ISP. the company is concerned about their own ISP

discussion.content: Provisioning of a server is more inline with IaaS!
I believe the given answer is correct. IaaS = host, PaaS = build. The tech is provisioning (building) a Linux server (the server platform and the OS), thus PaaS.
The answer should be D: IaaS. A PaaS vendor will provide and maintain the operating system that developers work on and the application runs on.
I think it's IaaS. PaaS is mostly applications, and the service provider would manage the servers/OS. Since the engineer is provisioning the server, that means it should be IaaS.
But PaaS does not allow you to chose the OS. Shouldn't it be IaaS ?

comments.content: I think the server already came with a Linux OS, so they would just be configuring it for the network upon receiving it. So technically, it would be an entire server and not just the software or OS.

questions.question_text: A network engineer is provisioning a new Linux server in a public cloud. Which of the following types of cloud service should be utilized?
